name: Eduardo Saverin
headline: Cofounder, Meta Platforms [../../companies/meta-platforms]
photoCredit: Photo by Juliana Tan for Forbes Asia
bioPoints:
Eduardo Saverin cofounded Meta Platforms, formerly Facebook, with Harvard
classmate Mark Zuckerberg in 2004.

name: Robert & Philip Ng
bioPoints:
Brothers Robert and Philip Ng control Far East Organization, one of Singapore's
largest private landlords and property developers.

name: Li Xiting
bioPoints:
Li Xiting is cofounder and chairman of Shenzhen Mindray Bio-Medical Electronics,
a supplier of medical devices.

name: Kwek Leng Beng & family
bioPoints:
Kwek Leng Beng is the executive chairman of Singapore's conglomerate Hong Leong
Group, founded by his father in 1941.

name: Goh Cheng Liang
photoCredit: Photo by Lianhe Zaobao/Singapore Press Holdings Limited
bioPoints:
Goh Cheng Liang gets the bulk of his wealth from a majority stake in Japan's
Nippon Paint Holdings, the world's fourth-largest paint manufacturer by revenue.

name: Khoo family
bioPoints:
The Khoos are the heirs of late banker Khoo Teck Puat, who invested in Standard
Chartered Bank in 1986.

name: Wee family
bioPoints:
The Wee family are the heirs of late banker Wee Cho Yaw, who was chairman
emeritus of United Overseas Bank when he died in February 2024 at age 95.

name: Kwee brothers
bioPoints:
The four Kwee siblings control privately held Pontiac Land, which owns an array
of luxury hotels and iconic office towers across the island nation.

name: Leo KoGuan
bioPoints:
Leo KoGuan is founder and chairman of $9.5 billion (sales) IT provider SHI
International, which his ex-wife Thai Lee, also a billionaire, runs as CEO.

name: Zhang Yong & Shu Ping
bioPoints:
Zhang Yong is the chairman of Sichuan hot pot chain Haidilao, which went public
in 2018. His wife Shu Ping is a cofounder.

name: Lee family
bioPoints:
The Lee family's fortune is derived from a stake in OCBC Bank, Singapore's
second-largest bank by assets.

name: Forrest Li
bioPoints:
Stanford grad Forrest Li founded and runs online gaming and e-commerce firm Sea,
which also has interests in e-payments and financial services.

name: Kuok Khoon Hong & family
photoCredit: Photo by Memphis West Pictures/Wilmar International
bioPoints:
Kuok Khoon Hong cofounded Wilmar in 1991 and built it into one of the world's
largest palm oil producers.

name: Robert Friedland
bioPoints:
Robert Friedland is founder and executive co-chairman of Toronto-listed Ivanhoe
Mines, a leader in the mining and precious metals industry.

name: Raj Kumar & Kishin RK
bioPoints:
Father-son pair, Raj Kumar and Kishin RK, are among Singapore's leading
landlords with their Royal Holdings and RB Capital property empire.

name: Gang Ye
bioPoints:
Gang Ye cofounded online gaming and e-commerce firm, Sea, with Forrest Li and
David Chen.

name: Lien family
bioPoints:
The Lien family owns a minority stake in United Overseas Bank, held through
their private investment firm named after the late patriarch, Lien Ying Chow.

name: Richard Chandler
bioPoints:
A native of New Zealand, Richard Chandler relocated to Singapore in 2006 where
he now runs Clermont Group, his personal investment outfit.

name: Choo Chong Ngen
photoCredit: Photo by Kua Chee Siong/The Straits Times/Newscom
bioPoints:
Hotel tycoon Choo Chong Ngen made his fortune in textiles before launching his
Hotel 81 budget chain in Geylang, Singapore's red-light district.

name: Ho family
bioPoints: Heirs of late banker Ho Sim Guan inherited his shares in United Overseas Bank.

name: Sam Goi
photoCredit: Photo by JOSEPH NAIR/The Business Times/Newscom
bioPoints:
Son of a Fujian farmer, Sam Goi owns Tee Yih Jia Food Manufacturing, one of the
world's largest makers of popiah skins, which are used for spring rolls.

name: Arvind Tiku
bioPoints:
Indian-born Singapore resident Arvind Tiku has interests in property and
renewable energy, held through his privately owned Singapore firms AT Holdings
and AT Investments.

name: Ji Qi
bioPoints:
Ji Qi is the founder and executive chairman of H World Group, one of China's
biggest multi-brand hotel groups.

name: Liang Xinjun
bioPoints:
Liang Xinjun is a former vice chairman and CEO of conglomerate Fosun
International.

name: Oei Hong Leong
photoCredit: Photo by Munshi Ahmed for Forbes
bioPoints:
Late Indonesian billionaire Eka Tjipta Widjaja's son, Oei Hong Leong, gets bulk
of his wealth from a corporate bond portfolio and real estate assets.

name: Peter Lim
bioPoints:
After cashing out of palm oil giant Wilmar more than a decade ago, former
stockbroker Peter Lim focused on healthcare, property and sports.

name: Ong Beng Seng & Christina Ong
photoCredit: Photo by Qian Jun/MB Media/Getty Images
bioPoints:
Ong Beng Seng (pictured) and his wife Christina Ong are one of Singapore's most
influential couples.

name: Asok Kumar Hiranandani
photoCredit: Photo by Munshi Ahmed for Forbes
bioPoints:
Asok Kumar Hiranandani is a cofounder of the erstwhile Royal Brothers property
group.

name: Koh Wee Meng
bioPoints:
Hotelier and property magnate Koh Wee Meng controls Fragrance Group with
interests extending to Australia and the U.K. He took the Singapore-listed
company private in 2021.

name: Ron Sim
bioPoints: Ron Sim is the founder of OSIM International, maker of high-end massage chairs.

name: Min-Liang Tan
bioPoints:
Min-Liang Tan gave up a law career in Singapore to start gaming devices company
Razer in 2005.

name: Tay family
bioPoints: The Tays are best known for their midmarket OG department stores.

name: Tang Wee Kit & family
bioPoints:
Tang Wee Kit is the chairman of Tang Holdings, a private investment and property
firm.

name: Binny Bansal
photoCredit: Photo by Arindom Chowdhury for xto10x Technologies
bioPoints:
Former Amazon executive Binny Bansal teamed up with pal Sachin Bansal in 2007 to
found Flipkart as an online seller of books, and later grew it into an
e-commerce giant.

name: Chew Gek Khim & family
photoCredit: Photo by RENDY ARYANTO/Visual Verve Studios/Straits Trading
bioPoints:
Chew Gek Khim is the chairman of Straits Trading, which has interests that
include real estate, hospitality and tin smelting.

name: Lim Hock Chee & family
photoCredit: Photo by Thong Kah Hoong/Singapore Press Holdings
bioPoints:
Son of a hog farmer, Lim Hock Chee started with a small stall selling pork in
1985.

name: Yao Hsiao Tung
bioPoints:
Yao Hsiao Tung is the executive chairman and CEO of Hi-P International, which
the former DuPont executive acquired as a small tool maker in 1983.

name: Chua Thian Poh
photoCredit: Photo by Nicky Loh for Forbes Asia
bioPoints:
High school dropout Chua Thian Poh got his start making hooks and spikes for the
logging industry.

name: Wong brothers
photoCredit: Photo by Yen Meng Jiin/The Business Times/Newscom
bioPoints:
Siblings Charles (pictured), Keith and Kelvin Wong own and run Charles & Keith,
Singapore's homegrown label known for its women's footwear and accessories.

name: Michael Kum
bioPoints:
Hotel tycoon Michael Kum runs a hospitality empire spanning 20 hotels across
Asia and Europe through his privately held M&L Hospitality.

name: John Lim
bioPoints:
John Lim cofounded real estate fund manager ARA Asset Management in 2002, at age
45, with the backing of Hong Kong billionaire Li Ka-shing.

name: Lim Kaling
bioPoints:
Lim Kaling is an early investor and non-executive director of Razer, a gaming
hardware maker that was set up in 2005.

name: Muhammed Aziz Khan
bioPoints:
Bangladesh-born Muhammed Aziz Khan, who resides in Singapore, is the chairman of
Summit Group.

name: Lim Chap Huat
photoCredit: Photo by RAJ NADARAJAN/The Straits Times/Newscom
bioPoints:
Son of a rickshaw driver, Lim Chap Huat set up a small construction outfit with
two partners in 1976 at age 22.

name: Zhong Sheng Jian
photoCredit: Photo by Kelvin Chng/The Business Times/Newscom
bioPoints:
Zhong Sheng Jian is the chairman of Singapore-listed Yanlord Land, one of the
largest non-government-owned real estate developers in China.

name: David Xueling Li
bioPoints:
David Xueling Li is chairman and cofounder of JOYY, a Nasdaq-listed,
Singapore-headquartered live streaming and social media platform.

name: Saurabh Mittal
bioPoints:
An engineer from the elite Indian Institute of Technology, Delhi, and a Harvard
B-School grad, Saurabh Mittal started out in the hedge fund business.

name: George Raymond Zage, III.
bioPoints:
George Raymond Zage III is the founder and CEO of Singapore-based investment
firm Tiga Investments.

name: Laurent Junique
bioPoints:
Laurent Junique is the CEO and founder of Singapore-based call center and
business process outsourcing firm TDCX.

name: David Chen
bioPoints:
David Chen is a cofounder of Singapore-headquartered online gaming and
e-commerce firm Sea, best known for its hit mobile game, Free Fire.
